name: repellency
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to force something to stop moving towards you: The hot pepper extracts were tested for their repellency to spider mites. They studied the repellency of different substances to rats.
the ability of a material to not allow a substance to be absorbed into it: The coating greatly increases the water repellency of the raincoat. The textiles were treated to provide repellency to both oil and water.
More examplesFewer examplesThese sleeping bags have built-in repellency and protection against mosquitoes.A product that displays water repellency can be said to be hydrophobic.
